sentences.english: Catholics pray to Mary as an intercessor.
sentences.chinese: 天主教徒向瑪利亞祈禱，並把她看作仲裁者。

sentences.english: One day he showed his friend a love poem he had written to Maria.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他把寫給瑪利亞的一首愛情詩拿給朋友看。

sentences.english: Let us take, for example, Rizzo's discussion of the Good Samaritan problem.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們以裏索討論的好撒瑪利亞人問題爲例。

sentences.english: Jehoahaz rested with his fathers and was buried in Samaria.
sentences.chinese: 約哈斯與他列祖同睡，葬在撒瑪利亞。

sentences.english: The priest tells the sinner, "You are forgiven go out and say three Hail Mary's. ""
sentences.chinese: 神父告訴他，，說三聲萬福瑪利亞你就會被原諒。

sentences.english: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion on him
sentences.chinese: 惟有一個撒瑪利亞人，行路來到那裏。

sentences.english: She prays that one day she will come and find her.
sentences.chinese: 她祈禱有一天瑪利亞能回來找她。

sentences.english: As an individual, Maria is the very definition of tenacity.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個個體，瑪利亞正是固執的詮釋。

sentences.english: Jews viewed Samaritans as half-breeds, both physically and spiritually.
sentences.chinese: 猶太人認爲撒瑪利亞人在肉體和靈魂上都是混血。

sentences.english: The singer was acquitted in 2005 by a jury in Santa Maria, Calif.
sentences.chinese: 該歌星在2005年被聖瑪利亞的陪審團宣判無罪。

sentences.english: Sor Juana and Maria became intimate friends, due to their closeness in age.
sentences.chinese: 瓊娜和瑪利亞年紀相仿，立即成爲好友。

sentences.english: 5Philip went down to a city in Samaria and proclaimed the Christ there.
sentences.chinese: 腓利下撒瑪利亞城去，宣講基督。

sentences.english: It is not to the Samaritans that Messias shall come.
sentences.chinese: 彌賽亞是不會去撒瑪利亞的。

sentences.english: Malia and Sasha are beautiful children and are so sweet to other people that they see.
sentences.chinese: 瑪利亞和薩沙在別人看來，又漂亮，又可愛。

sentences.english: The priest absolved him and told him to say ten hail Mary's.
sentences.chinese: 神父宣告寬恕了他，並要他說十遍萬福瑪利亞。

sentences.english: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.
sentences.chinese: 腓利下撒瑪利亞城去，宣講基督。

definition: Kohl (name)/Helmut Kohl (1930-2017), German CDU politician, Chancellor 1982-1998
El Niño (meteorology)/Holy Infant (cf biblical nativity story)
to suffer a calamity/to suffer (e.g. under torture)/distress
Roth (name)/Kenneth Roth (1955-), executive director of Human Rights Watch 人權觀察|人权观察[Ren2 quan2 Guan1 cha2]
Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
